comments:
Running eclipse and opening help gives me an error that I need to set a browser in the preferences.

Using the SWT browser widget in my app gives me the error:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path (MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3400)
	at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:136)

Now, I'm sure I can fix this by setting MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME, but I'm going to be distributing the app for a demo using web start, and it is going to be embarassing to me if I have to ask the customer to set an environment variable.

I understand that eclipse/swt makes an effort to find the browser, I'm wondering if some reasonable searching for solaris x86 could be added.

For reference, I'm using Solaris 10.  I'm also running as root, in case that is relevant.

Browser support is not currently implemented on Solaris.  Hopefully the 3.3 timeframe will provide an opportunity to revisit this.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 77217 ***

traces.message: No more handles [Unknown Mozilla path (MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not set)]
